author: Staff Reporter
text:
Tribal People’s Council has demanded that action be taken against the forest department personnel in Kanyakumari district for brutally attacking tribal people recently.

In a letter to Rameshwar Oran, Chairperson of the National Commission for scheduled Tribe, New Delhi, the council chairman K.A. Gunasekaran said that on January 27, M. Ramachandran, a railway employee and S. Rajan, president of Pechiparai in Kanyakumari district, were beaten up by forest department personnel injuring them.

The letter said that the police refused to prevent the attack and remained mute spectators.

The letter urged the chairperson to investigate the matter.
title: Atrocities against tribal people condemned
